datasetStructure: One record per microbiology susceptibility test (or other organism-related finding) per organism found in MB

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSSEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: MSSEQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain to support relationships within the domain and between domains. In MS, used to link to organism in MB.
datasetVariables.label: Group ID
datasetVariables.name: MSGRPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSREFID

datasetVariables.description: Internal or external specimen identifier. Example: Specimen ID.
datasetVariables.label: Reference ID
datasetVariables.name: MSREFID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSSPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: MSSPID

modelClassVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSTESTCD

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or finding described in MSTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in MSTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g."1TEST). MSTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples for GROWTH findings: EXTGROW, COLCOUNT. For SUSCEPTIBILITY findings, the test is the drug the organism was tested with, i.e. PENICLLN, AMOXCLLN.
datasetVariables.label: Microbiology Organism Finding Short Name
datasetVariables.name: MSTESTCD

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSTEST

datasetVariables.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. Examples for GROWTH findings: Extent of Growth, Colony Count. Examples for SUSCEPTIBILITY findings: Amoxicillin Susceptibility, Penicillin Susceptibility
datasetVariables.label: Organism Test or Finding Name
datasetVariables.name: MSTEST

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a category of related records. Examples: GROWTH, SUSCEPTIBILITY.
datasetVariables.label: Category for Organism Findings
datasetVariables.name: MSCAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSSCAT

datasetVariables.description: A further categorization of a test category. Examples: CULTURE, ISOLATE
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory for Organism Findings
datasetVariables.name: MSSCAT

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

priorVersion.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSORRES

self.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

datasetVariables.description: Result of the Microbiology Organism measurement or finding as originally received or collected. Examples for GROWTH findings: GROWTH INTO 3RD QUADRANT. Examples for SUSCEPTIBLITY findings:.0080,.0023
datasetVariables.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
datasetVariables.name: MSORRES

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSORRESU

datasetVariables.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for MSORRES. Example: mcg/mL
datasetVariables.label: Original Units
datasetVariables.name: MSORRESU

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSSTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from MSORRES in a standard format or standard units. MSSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in MSSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "+3 MODERATE", "MOD", and "MODERATE", and in MSORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in MSSTRESC as "MODERATE".
datasetVariables.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
datasetVariables.name: MSSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from MSSTRESC. MSSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: MSSTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSSTRESU

datasetVariables.description: Standardized unit used for MSSTRESC and MSSTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: MSSTRESU

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C85495

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSRESCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding in a standard format. Example for SUSCEPTIBILITY finding: SUSCEPTIBLE, INTERMEDIATE, RESISTANT, or UNKNOWN.
datasetVariables.label: Result Category
datasetVariables.name: MSRESCAT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSSTAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate a test on an organism was not done, or a test was not performed. Should be null if a result exists in MSORRES or have a value of NOT DONE.
datasetVariables.label: Completion Status
datasetVariables.name: MSSTAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSREASND

datasetVariables.description: Reason not done. Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Used in conjunction with MSSTAT when value is NOT DONE. Example: SAMPLE LOST
datasetVariables.label: Reason Test Not Done
datasetVariables.name: MSREASND

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSNAM

datasetVariables.description: Name or identifier of the laboratory or vendor that provided the test results.
datasetVariables.label: Vendor Name
datasetVariables.name: MSNAM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSLOINC

datasetVariables.description: 1. Dictionary-derived LOINC Code for MSTEST. 2. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the define.xml external codelist attributes
datasetVariables.label: LOINC Code
datasetVariables.name: MSLOINC

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C85492

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSMETHOD

datasetVariables.description: Method of the test or examination. Example: GRAM STAIN, MACRO BROTH DILUTION, AGAR DILUTION
datasetVariables.label: Method of Test or Examination
datasetVariables.name: MSMETHOD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSBLFL

datasetVariables.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. The value should be "Y" or null.
datasetVariables.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariables.name: MSBLFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSDRVFL

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be Y or null. Records that represent the average of other records or some other derivation, and those that do not come from the CRF, are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If MSDRVFL=Y, then MSORRES may be null, with MSSTRESC and (if numeric) MSSTRESN having the derived value.
datasetVariables.label: Derived Flag
datasetVariables.name: MSDRVFL

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.VISITNUM

datasetVariables.description: 1. Clinical encounter number. 2. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Number
datasetVariables.name: VISITNUM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.VISIT

datasetVariables.description: 1. Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. 2. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Name
datasetVariables.name: VISIT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.VISITDY

datasetVariables.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
datasetVariables.name: VISITDY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSDY

datasetVariables.description: 1. Study day of the test, measured as integer days. 2. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. This formula should be consistent across the submission.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Test
datasetVariables.name: MSDY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSTPT

datasetVariables.description: 1. Text Description of time when test should be done.  2. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See MSTPTNUM and MSTPTREF. Examples: Start, 5 min post.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Name
datasetVariables.name: MSTPT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSTPTNUM

datasetVariables.description: Numerical version of MSTPT to aid in sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Number
datasetVariables.name: MSTPTNUM

modelClassVariable.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

priorVersion.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariables.description: Elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (MSTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by MSTPTREF, or "P8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by MSTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariables.name: MSELTM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MS.MSTPTREF

datasetVariables.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by MSELTM, MSTPTNUM, and MSTPT. Example: PREVIOUS DOSE.
datasetVariables.label: Time Point Reference
datasetVariables.name: MSTPTREF

description: A findings domain that represents drug susceptibility testing results only. This includes phenotypic testing (where drug is added directly to a culture of organisms) and genotypic tests that provide results in terms of susceptible or resistant. Drug susceptibility testing may occur on a wide variety of non-host organisms, including bacteria, viruses, fungi, protozoa and parasites. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C61531, 2018-06-29)
label: Microbiology Susceptibility Test
name: MS
